Yes, sir.

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: What -- other products of the company.

turn.speaker: joseph_c_jacobs
turn.label: Mr. Joseph C. Jacobs
turn.text: Sir?

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: He sold other products of the company.

turn.speaker: joseph_c_jacobs
turn.label: Mr. Joseph C. Jacobs
turn.text: Of the company, yes, sir.
Other product of the same company and if we have jurisdiction over the company, we have jurisdiction over --

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: What was the use --

turn.speaker: joseph_c_jacobs
turn.label: Mr. Joseph C. Jacobs
turn.text: -- all of the companies.

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: -- does he sell commodities as to which your use tax applied?

turn.speaker: joseph_c_jacobs
turn.label: Mr. Joseph C. Jacobs
turn.text: No, sir.
He sold -- but I'm convinced that he sold products as -- as to which our sales tax apply which is all a part of one statute --

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: Well, I --

turn.speaker: joseph_c_jacobs
turn.label: Mr. Joseph C. Jacobs
turn.text: -- the sales of use tax.

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: Are -- are the -- the taxes or the levies on Scripto for what that salesman performed in Florida in question?

turn.speaker: joseph_c_jacobs
turn.label: Mr. Joseph C. Jacobs
turn.text: No, sir.

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: And -- and in fact, taxes were imposed by your State for activities of his.

turn.speaker: joseph_c_jacobs
turn.label: Mr. Joseph C. Jacobs
turn.text: This one salesman?

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: Yes.

turn.speaker: joseph_c_jacobs
turn.label: Mr. Joseph C. Jacobs
turn.text: No, sir.

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: One must --

turn.speaker: joseph_c_jacobs
turn.label: Mr. Joseph C. Jacobs
turn.text: Was -- as a result of the 10 jobbers to --

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: But why not?

turn.speaker: joseph_c_jacobs
turn.label: Mr. Joseph C. Jacobs
turn.text: Because he sold no -- no products that were subject to the use tax --

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: I see.

turn.speaker: joseph_c_jacobs
turn.label: Mr. Joseph C. Jacobs
turn.text: -- with which we were familiar.

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: I see.

turn.speaker: tom_c_clark
turn.label: Justice Tom C. Clark
turn.text: Did the Scripto man have any connection with the jobbers when he supervised them or anything like that?

turn.speaker: joseph_c_jacobs
turn.label: Mr. Joseph C. Jacobs
turn.text: Not -- none that -- none that I know of, sir.
And the record would not -- does not reveal it.

turn.speaker: william_j_brennan_jr
turn.label: Justice William J. Brennan, Jr.
turn.text: Well, let me see, Mr. Jacobs, I gather, the products that he sold were subjected to your sales tax collected --

turn.speaker: joseph_c_jacobs
turn.label: Mr. Joseph C. Jacobs
turn.text: Yes, sir.

turn.speaker: william_j_brennan_jr
turn.label: Justice William J. Brennan, Jr.
turn.text: -- by the retailers who sold --

turn.speaker: joseph_c_jacobs
turn.label: Mr. Joseph C. Jacobs
turn.text: Yes, sir.
That's correct.

turn.speaker: william_j_brennan_jr
turn.label: Justice William J. Brennan, Jr.
turn.text: What --

turn.speaker: joseph_c_jacobs
turn.label: Mr. Joseph C. Jacobs
turn.text: We can presume not to.

turn.speaker: william_j_brennan_jr
turn.label: Justice William J. Brennan, Jr.
turn.text: -- the order -- those for which he had taken orders from them?
Isn't that it?

turn.speaker: joseph_c_jacobs
turn.label: Mr. Joseph C. Jacobs
turn.text: Yes.
Yes, sir.

turn.speaker: william_j_brennan_jr
turn.label: Justice William J. Brennan, Jr.
turn.text: And so, Scripto is not involved in -- in the sales of those pens and in that sense, as far as your tax law is concerned?

turn.speaker: joseph_c_jacobs
turn.label: Mr. Joseph C. Jacobs
turn.text: You -- you will recall that there was another element of the case before the Florida Supreme Court, something to do with that.

turn.speaker: william_j_brennan_jr
turn.label: Justice William J. Brennan, Jr.
turn.text: Yes, I will --

turn.speaker: joseph_c_jacobs
turn.label: Mr. Joseph C. Jacobs
turn.text: But that was --

turn.speaker: william_j_brennan_jr
turn.label: Justice William J. Brennan, Jr.
turn.text: That is not here.

turn.speaker: joseph_c_jacobs
turn.label: Mr. Joseph C. Jacobs
turn.text: -- that is not the subject.
No, sir.
It's not here.
It's not subject to appear.

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: Well, that -- so that the salesman, this single salesman, the purpose -- the purpose that this single salesman served you is that by his presence, you say Scripto is localized in Florida.

turn.speaker: joseph_c_jacobs
turn.label: Mr. Joseph C. Jacobs
turn.text: I say that because of --

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: So far as the corporation can exist.
Scripto existed in Florida because that salesman was there.
Is that your point?

turn.speaker: joseph_c_jacobs
turn.label: Mr. Joseph C. Jacobs
turn.text: That is eminently correct, sir.

turn.speaker: charles_e_whittaker
turn.label: Justice Charles E. Whittaker
turn.text: Or -- you --

turn.speaker: joseph_c_jacobs
turn.label: Mr. Joseph C. Jacobs
turn.text: Yes --

turn.speaker: charles_e_whittaker
turn.label: Justice Charles E. Whittaker
turn.text: Really?

turn.speaker: joseph_c_jacobs
turn.label: Mr. Joseph C. Jacobs
turn.text: Sir?

turn.speaker: charles_e_whittaker
turn.label: Justice Charles E. Whittaker
turn.text: That is domesticated there just because they have a salesman there?

turn.speaker: joseph_c_jacobs
turn.label: Mr. Joseph C. Jacobs
turn.text: No, sir.

turn.speaker: charles_e_whittaker
turn.label: Justice Charles E. Whittaker
turn.text: Or do you mean that within International Shoe, it has -- as you contacted (Voice Overlap) --

turn.speaker: joseph_c_jacobs
turn.label: Mr. Joseph C. Jacobs
turn.text: That's exactly (Voice Overlap) --

turn.speaker: charles_e_whittaker
turn.label: Justice Charles E. Whittaker
turn.text: -- due process?

turn.speaker: joseph_c_jacobs
turn.label: Mr. Joseph C. Jacobs
turn.text: Yes, sir.
Yes, sir, that the requirements of due process are met.

turn.speaker: charles_e_whittaker
turn.label: Justice Charles E. Whittaker
turn.text: Now -- now, then, may I ask you please, sir.

turn.speaker: joseph_c_jacobs
turn.label: Mr. Joseph C. Jacobs
turn.text: Yes, sir.

turn.speaker: charles_e_whittaker
turn.label: Justice Charles E. Whittaker
turn.text: Is under your -- is there any liability under your sales and use tax law upon these independent contractors who make these sales?

turn.speaker: joseph_c_jacobs
turn.label: Mr. Joseph C. Jacobs
turn.text: You mean --

turn.speaker: charles_e_whittaker
turn.label: Justice Charles E. Whittaker
turn.text: Do you understand?
Independent contractors involved here.
They are the persons who solicit as I understand these -- these orders.Does your statute impose any liability on them for sales or use taxes?

turn.speaker: joseph_c_jacobs
turn.label: Mr. Joseph C. Jacobs
turn.text: Yes, sir.
I believe the requirement would be on them to pay it, if it was not -- if it was not collected previously.

turn.speaker: charles_e_whittaker
turn.label: Justice Charles E. Whittaker
turn.text: And there, they are present aren't they, as independent contractors operating in making these --

turn.speaker: joseph_c_jacobs
turn.label: Mr. Joseph C. Jacobs
turn.text: Yes, sir.

turn.speaker: charles_e_whittaker
turn.label: Justice Charles E. Whittaker
turn.text: -- solicitations.

turn.speaker: joseph_c_jacobs
turn.label: Mr. Joseph C. Jacobs
turn.text: Yes, sir.
That's correct.

turn.speaker: charles_e_whittaker
turn.label: Justice Charles E. Whittaker
turn.text: And to the extent they pay, there could be no liability on the nonresident seller, do they?

turn.speaker: joseph_c_jacobs
turn.label: Mr. Joseph C. Jacobs
turn.text: That's correct, sir.

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: Could you subject that single salesman for Scripto to a license tax?

turn.speaker: joseph_c_jacobs
turn.label: Mr. Joseph C. Jacobs
turn.text: Possibly, we do.
We charge him a $1 registration fee, every dealer who qualifies.
The -- the requirement is that he --

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: And you -- you think you can license a drummer who comes into the State merely to show examples and then all the orders have to be transmitted outside the State and everything else is been outside the State?

turn.speaker: joseph_c_jacobs
turn.label: Mr. Joseph C. Jacobs
turn.text: I believe this Court has found on that --

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: Yes, this Court found on that --

turn.speaker: joseph_c_jacobs
turn.label: Mr. Joseph C. Jacobs
turn.text: -- (Voice Overlap) yes, sir.

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: -- found in a good word.
[Laughter]

turn.speaker: earl_warren
turn.label: Chief Justice Earl Warren
turn.text: Does this salesman have any -- any contact at all [Laughs] with the -- with the brokers?

turn.speaker: joseph_c_jacobs
turn.label: Mr. Joseph C. Jacobs
turn.text: None -- none that the record reveals nor that I am aware of, no, sir.
And as far as I'm -- as far as I'm concerned, he had nothing.

turn.speaker: earl_warren
turn.label: Chief Justice Earl Warren
turn.text: Yes.

turn.speaker: joseph_c_jacobs
turn.label: Mr. Joseph C. Jacobs
turn.text: As far as I know, he had nothing to do with it.

And may I -- may I close with these -- these remarks that there is no requirement placed on Scripto through the use tax that there is not in a corresponding requirement placed on Florida merchant under the sales tax, this is one bill.
The sales and use tax passed in about the same session of the legislature, then administered by the same man.

And if, the -- in the administration of that Act as has been suggested by the appellant, some unreasonable or some unrelated benefit was given to the local citizen that was not given to the foreign -- foreign citizen of the foreign merchant.
I know that this Court would strike that down and there is none to my knowledge.
We feel that the operation of the sales and use tax is a complementary tax and that -- that there is no unreasonable, there is no distinction made.

turn.speaker: potter_stewart
turn.label: Justice Potter Stewart
turn.text: How about the capacity to sue in the State of Florida?

turn.speaker: joseph_c_jacobs
turn.label: Mr. Joseph C. Jacobs
turn.text: I was most concerned about the statement that was made that that related only to out-of-state merchants, if that is -- I'm not aware of any opinion to that effect.
I do not believe that it -- that it would be construed that way and if it was, it would be unconstitutional.

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: How do you enforce this -- how do you enforce the acts against the Georgia corporation?

turn.speaker: joseph_c_jacobs
turn.label: Mr. Joseph C. Jacobs
turn.text: How do we enforce this -- the Use Tax --

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: Yes.

turn.speaker: joseph_c_jacobs
turn.label: Mr. Joseph C. Jacobs
turn.text: -- Act?
We would -- we would periodically audit the books of --

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: Where, in Georgia?

turn.speaker: joseph_c_jacobs
turn.label: Mr. Joseph C. Jacobs
turn.text: Wherever we could get them.
Yes, sir.

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: Suppose they won't let you?

turn.speaker: joseph_c_jacobs
turn.label: Mr. Joseph C. Jacobs
turn.text: Our order to the statute requires --

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: Yes.

turn.speaker: joseph_c_jacobs
turn.label: Mr. Joseph C. Jacobs
turn.text: -- to do so.
And if they (Inaudible) they don't, their -- their permit to do business and --

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: Do they need a permit to do business?

turn.speaker: joseph_c_jacobs
turn.label: Mr. Joseph C. Jacobs
turn.text: They have -- they have to -- to qualify under the Sales Tax Act by paying a $1 fee and making an application.
And to -- and -- and they must continue to be qualified by -- by collecting tax.

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: How do you get to their books?
How do you get to their books in Georgia unless, if they have strong notions of not letting you see their books, how do you get to see them?

turn.speaker: joseph_c_jacobs
turn.label: Mr. Joseph C. Jacobs
turn.text: We -- we get to see them because the statute requires --

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: Yes, but I know --

turn.speaker: joseph_c_jacobs
turn.label: Mr. Joseph C. Jacobs
turn.text: (Voice Overlap) --

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: -- but your statute can't govern -- can't control people in Georgia.

turn.speaker: joseph_c_jacobs
turn.label: Mr. Joseph C. Jacobs
turn.text: It can't control people in Florida either, if they don't want to abide by the law.

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: Oh, yes, you can.
You can get all sorts of court orders in Florida, not against people who are not resident there.

turn.speaker: joseph_c_jacobs
turn.label: Mr. Joseph C. Jacobs
turn.text: We feel that we would be entitled under the Act to get an injunction to enjoin them from doing business in the State of Florida, unless they pay the -- their -- their just taxes.

turn.speaker: charles_e_whittaker
turn.label: Justice Charles E. Whittaker
turn.text: Mr. Jacobs, does that mean you're arguing that Scripto, just Atlanta concern, must file some kind of an application and get a little license before it can do interstate commerce in Florida?

turn.speaker: joseph_c_jacobs
turn.label: Mr. Joseph C. Jacobs
turn.text: No, sir.
Not at all.
Not at all, sir.

turn.speaker: charles_e_whittaker
turn.label: Justice Charles E. Whittaker
turn.text: What -- what now?
Why not then?
You say the -- they -- they must get the -- file an application and get a license through.

turn.speaker: joseph_c_jacobs
turn.label: Mr. Joseph C. Jacobs
turn.text: No, sir.

They -- they must -- they must -- the statute provides that -- I don't have a performer, the statute provides that the person must make and must become qualified and -- and there is no -- there's -- there's no -- all the qualification consist of is letting them know who -- who runs the business and sending a dollar.
That's what the statute --

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: (Voice Overlap) but suppose they don't want to do that, can you prevent it from getting orders from Florida?

turn.speaker: joseph_c_jacobs
turn.label: Mr. Joseph C. Jacobs
turn.text: No, sir.

turn.speaker: charles_e_whittaker
turn.label: Justice Charles E. Whittaker
turn.text: You said if they --

turn.speaker: joseph_c_jacobs
turn.label: Mr. Joseph C. Jacobs
turn.text: But if there is a --

turn.speaker: charles_e_whittaker
turn.label: Justice Charles E. Whittaker
turn.text: Excuse me -- excuse me.

turn.speaker: joseph_c_jacobs
turn.label: Mr. Joseph C. Jacobs
turn.text: Yes.

If there is a jurisdictional contact that -- that is sufficient to satisfy the Due Process Clause, then we can -- then we can require them to -- to collect the -- collect the use tax and make an application and -- and make a don't --

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: We still don't --

turn.speaker: joseph_c_jacobs
turn.label: Mr. Joseph C. Jacobs
turn.text: -- remit.

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: -- we don't --

turn.speaker: charles_e_whittaker
turn.label: Justice Charles E. Whittaker
turn.text: Then you're in --

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: You're troubled, how you get into Georgia, if they don't come into Georgia?
They just wanted to do interstate business and do not -- may do not want to do anything of what they call local business.
They want -- this Court has said, “Make them free to get business out of Florida and Tennessee and Montana and anywhere else.”

turn.speaker: joseph_c_jacobs
turn.label: Mr. Joseph C. Jacobs
turn.text: Yes, sir.

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: Now, what I want to know is how do you effectuate this tax?
You say you can order their books, but they won't let you order their book unless you go to apply at Georgia court and the Georgia court --

turn.speaker: joseph_c_jacobs
turn.label: Mr. Joseph C. Jacobs
turn.text: We would seek to -- to enjoin them from continuing to do business in the State of Florida.

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: But you can't keep them out because you have no right to exact any permission from them to come in.

turn.speaker: joseph_c_jacobs
turn.label: Mr. Joseph C. Jacobs
turn.text: No, sir.
Not in so far as they -- as -- as far as they are doing a business consistent with the Miller case.
But suppose they're doing a business with -- consistent with the General Trading case --

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: Well that's your (Voice Overlap) --

turn.speaker: joseph_c_jacobs
turn.label: Mr. Joseph C. Jacobs
turn.text: -- how would we operate?

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: But the Florida injunction runs into Georgia?

turn.speaker: joseph_c_jacobs
turn.label: Mr. Joseph C. Jacobs
turn.text: No, sir.

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: Well, how do you get that, then?

turn.speaker: joseph_c_jacobs
turn.label: Mr. Joseph C. Jacobs
turn.text: No, sir.
We would get an injunction in Florida where they -- or where we were -- we find that -- that they have been doing business to keep them from doing business.

turn.speaker: charles_e_whittaker
turn.label: Justice Charles E. Whittaker
turn.text: May I ask you?
Would that injunction must (Inaudible) would that injunction be against Scripto from shipping goods from Atlanta into Florida?

turn.speaker: joseph_c_jacobs
turn.label: Mr. Joseph C. Jacobs
turn.text: No, sir.
That -- no, sir.
That --

turn.speaker: charles_e_whittaker
turn.label: Justice Charles E. Whittaker
turn.text: What would it -- would -- would enjoin Georgia (Voice Overlap) --

turn.speaker: joseph_c_jacobs
turn.label: Mr. Joseph C. Jacobs
turn.text: (Voice Overlap) from coming and soliciting and taking sales within -- within the State of Florida.

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: But you've said (Voice Overlap) --

turn.speaker: charles_e_whittaker
turn.label: Justice Charles E. Whittaker
turn.text: But I understood it was now doing that.
Is it --

turn.speaker: joseph_c_jacobs
turn.label: Mr. Joseph C. Jacobs
turn.text: But we're -- we're presuming -- we -- we -- I believe that we are -- we are presuming that -- that the facts related would come within the Miller case.

Now, I am presuming the facts would come within the General Trading case where -- where there is jurisdictional contact, where the State -- where -- where the taxing State does have the authority to require the out-of-state merchant to collect the tax and to remit.

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: And you would get an injunction against somebody who -- isn't it worthy -- the Corporation for the purposes of your law and then you got an injunction or a judgment against them, they don't obey, then you go into the other State and under the Full Faith and Credit clause, you take an enforcement of it.
Is that it?

turn.speaker: joseph_c_jacobs
turn.label: Mr. Joseph C. Jacobs
turn.text: No, sir.
Not at all.

turn.speaker: william_j_brennan_jr
turn.label: Justice William J. Brennan, Jr.
turn.text: But once you get it, could you -- on the same approach, why couldn't you get a money judgment for the amount of tax?

turn.speaker: joseph_c_jacobs
turn.label: Mr. Joseph C. Jacobs
turn.text: Because there is no way to -- to prove it unless we can see the books of the company.
We have no --

turn.speaker: william_j_brennan_jr
turn.label: Justice William J. Brennan, Jr.
turn.text: Well, I -- well, I gather, your idea is that they're in the State for purposes of service of process by reason of the activities of this --

turn.speaker: joseph_c_jacobs
turn.label: Mr. Joseph C. Jacobs
turn.text: Yes, sir.

turn.speaker: william_j_brennan_jr
turn.label: Justice William J. Brennan, Jr.
turn.text: -- solicit, is that so?

turn.speaker: joseph_c_jacobs
turn.label: Mr. Joseph C. Jacobs
turn.text: Yes, sir.

turn.speaker: william_j_brennan_jr
turn.label: Justice William J. Brennan, Jr.
turn.text: Well, and that I take it, would suffice to start to bring them in the State for the purposes of a lawsuit.

turn.speaker: joseph_c_jacobs
turn.label: Mr. Joseph C. Jacobs
turn.text: Yes, sir.

turn.speaker: william_j_brennan_jr
turn.label: Justice William J. Brennan, Jr.
turn.text: Don't you have discovery procedures and things like that under your --

turn.speaker: joseph_c_jacobs
turn.label: Mr. Joseph C. Jacobs
turn.text: Yes, sir and I presume we would.
I -- I'm sorry, I think I've led the Court of Appeal on this injunction speaking about something I had -- knew little about.

turn.speaker: hugo_l_black
turn.label: Justice Hugo L. Black
turn.text: You take your chances on the collective ones if you -- if this Court okayed the statute?
[Laughs]

turn.speaker: joseph_c_jacobs
turn.label: Mr. Joseph C. Jacobs
turn.text: Yes, sir.
I believe we will.
Thank you for that.

section.heading: Rebuttal of George B. Haley, Jr.

turn.speaker: earl_warren
turn.label: Chief Justice Earl Warren
turn.text: If I must --

turn.speaker: george_b_haley_jr
turn.label: Mr. George B. Haley, Jr.
turn.text: If I could comment just on the procedural questions as how -- as to how this case came up.

They were threatening to attach or garnish some of our account receivable and we came into Court and asked for an injunction against that Act as to how they get the information or the figures on which to base an assessment the statute provides.
You either furnish them in the books, so they make an assessment from the best information available to them and that that assessment is presumptively correct.

I would like to point out that this statute does require that we apply to the control of it for a permit as a dealer in the State that we pay this minimum dollar registration fee that we appoint an agent for service or process upon us in the State at least as to liabilities arising under this Act that we maybe required in the discretion of the Comptroller to put up a cash or a collateral bond to secure the performance of our obligations under this contract, under the statute which is certainly a provision which is more likely to be administered by the Comptroller to require the State concerns to put up such deposit.
And I'd like to point out that in Miller Bros., there was far more involved than mere advertising.
The furniture store, in that case, delivered 67% of its -- its sales to Mount -- Maryland residence in its own trust.
21% of its total sales were consummated by delivery by interstate carrier.
Both of those cases then, he would know the destination of the sale, the -- that the purchaser was a resident of Maryland.
12% only of its total sales were consummated by delivery to the purchaser in the store.
And even in those cases, if the purchaser bought on credit which the -- under the stipulation of facts was commonly done, the seller would know the destination ultimately of the sale.
Now, I'd like to point out also that it's not only --

turn.speaker: potter_stewart
turn.label: Justice Potter Stewart
turn.text: There was no -- there was no mail order business in Miller, was there?
I mean, the -- the --

turn.speaker: george_b_haley_jr
turn.label: Mr. George B. Haley, Jr.
turn.text: There was.

turn.speaker: potter_stewart
turn.label: Justice Potter Stewart
turn.text: -- the purchase was negotiated at -- on the premises of the store in Delaware.

turn.speaker: george_b_haley_jr
turn.label: Mr. George B. Haley, Jr.
turn.text: There may have been some limited mail order business.
There -- there were some ads mailed out to regular account customers.

turn.speaker: potter_stewart
turn.label: Justice Potter Stewart
turn.text: Advertising.

turn.speaker: george_b_haley_jr
turn.label: Mr. George B. Haley, Jr.
turn.text: And in some cases, they may have --

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: That was --

turn.speaker: george_b_haley_jr
turn.label: Mr. George B. Haley, Jr.
turn.text: -- they may have had a coupon or something.
I am not familiar to --

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: -- advertising solicitation, wasn't there?

turn.speaker: george_b_haley_jr
turn.label: Mr. George B. Haley, Jr.
turn.text: There was advertising solicitation, definitely.

turn.speaker: potter_stewart
turn.label: Justice Potter Stewart
turn.text: But on the facts --

turn.speaker: george_b_haley_jr
turn.label: Mr. George B. Haley, Jr.
turn.text: Yes.

turn.speaker: potter_stewart
turn.label: Justice Potter Stewart
turn.text: -- that purchasers went to -- to Delaware and -- and into the store --

turn.speaker: george_b_haley_jr
turn.label: Mr. George B. Haley, Jr.
turn.text: That's right.

turn.speaker: potter_stewart
turn.label: Justice Potter Stewart
turn.text: -- and makes (Voice Overlap) --

turn.speaker: george_b_haley_jr
turn.label: Mr. George B. Haley, Jr.
turn.text: That's right, but they didn't always take delivery there.

turn.speaker: potter_stewart
turn.label: Justice Potter Stewart
turn.text: I understood.

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: What do you make of this drummer or salesman in -- in your case?

turn.speaker: george_b_haley_jr
turn.label: Mr. George B. Haley, Jr.
turn.text: You mean Nippert -- such as the Nippert case?

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: No, no, Scripto salesman --

turn.speaker: george_b_haley_jr
turn.label: Mr. George B. Haley, Jr.
turn.text: Oh.

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: -- in this case.

turn.speaker: george_b_haley_jr
turn.label: Mr. George B. Haley, Jr.
turn.text: Oh.
In this case, it is a stipulated fact that he has no connection whatever with the Adgif sales.

I say that under Norton Company against Department of Revenue, since we have satisfied the burden of separating his activity from the activity in question -- from the sales in question, the Commerce Clause would forbid the imposition of this duty with respect to Adgif sales by virtue of the activity of that salesman --

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: Mr. Jacobs --

turn.speaker: george_b_haley_jr
turn.label: Mr. George B. Haley, Jr.
turn.text: -- which is unconnected.

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: But, Mr. Jacobs' argument is that the corporation is there, figuratively speaking, because they've got a salesman there.

turn.speaker: george_b_haley_jr
turn.label: Mr. George B. Haley, Jr.
turn.text: This --

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: And Scripto has seen fit not to differentiate by way of corporations this business for which their job.
What do you say to that?

turn.speaker: george_b_haley_jr
turn.label: Mr. George B. Haley, Jr.
turn.text: Mr. Justice Frankfurter, this Court has never held that mere solicitation of orders subjects a corporation to the jurisdiction of a state for all purposes.

In International Shoe, this Court was careful to point out that the liability imposed, that is the State unemployment tax, arose out of that very limited activity, namely the employment of employees in the State (Inaudible).
And that the cause of action in -- in that suit arose out of that same activity.
And therefore, that the State -- State have the jurisdiction to tax and the Court had jurisdiction over the corporation.
But this Court has not gone further than that under the Due Process Clause.

turn.speaker: earl_warren
turn.label: Chief Justice Earl Warren
turn.text: Very well.
Thank you, gentlemen.
